This song is cool and extremely well-crafted, but it also vividly depicts an inner-movie scene that resonates with the listener on a variety of levels and feels real and authentic. The simple fact that so few people today are actually capable of singing a song like this demonstrates mastery. You could count them on one hand. Not only Bruno and Anderson are excellent, but the entire group is as well! A winning attitude is added to the mix by the hip dancing moves and the music, which is smooth and direct at the same time. Bravo!

Filipinos look Hispanic, eat Asian and sing like black people. Shout out to all the soulful Blackapinos. Most people don't know they (Filipinos )were originally called Negritos. They were invaded by and mixed with the Japanese, then Spanish, and finally the Americans. Many black American soldiers defected and joined Filipino forces against America to help them win their war for independence. Shout out to all my Blackapinos!

WHERE IS HEEEE
De CD van Bruno mars is het iets of niets? Smoking out the window is een CD van Bruno Mars samen met Anderson Paak. In dat nummer zingen ze over een relatie wat uit is gegaan. Bruno Mars is een goede artiest die veel goede muziek maakt bijvoorbeeld Uptown funk. Hij was eerst een producer voor andere artiesten, daarna is hij uitgegroeid tot een bekende zanger. Hij is populair bij oudere mensen maar ook bij jongere mensen.   Het liedje Smoking out the window is een lied wat valt onder popmuziek. De muziek bouwt op wat dat betekent is dat het zachtjes begint en steeds harder gaat, daarna bouwt het weer af tot het lied stopt. Tussen door gebeurd dat ook een paar keer. Ik vind dat Bruno Mars goed kan zingen. Dat hoor je ook terug in het nummer

I don't like music I love music
Amazing groove, I love this music so much, the harmonies, the dancing, too bad they waste it all on sexist tropes. It's so funny I think (I THINK, can't be sure) that in a decade artists like this, whose main goal is probably not to be misogynist, mean or provocative but are all about the music, won't do this anymore. Anderson Paak and Bruno Mars (and The Weekend as well, he's a good example) all have terribly sexist lyrics, but get away with it completely, I guess mainly because they are popular and fantastic musicians. And I'm torn. I love them as a music lover, but I am also a woman and it's just one of those things that sucks. What I do is I just tell myself: Not yet I guess. Personally, I really wish I could get over the "bitch" part and the wonderful story about how this terrible gold digging woman is being a total whore, but I can't. I should add I totally get the classic feel they are going for, and this might include lyrics, but there is a reason we are (hopefully) leaving "this horrible whore woman broke my poor heart while I am an angel" songs behind. Some "classic" elements are not worth keeping.

I remember early last year I went through this. But I guess I am just a sucker like alot of people would call it. There are other names people will call it. Something like simp, weak minded and others I cant think of. Y'all are right, but some of us dont have the success stories. Glad there are songs to represent what some of us go through. Jay Z might have "99 problems, but a bitch ain't one". However some of us have all the problems; 100% of the problems. And I know there will be people telling me "it's your fault" or "grow up", but they are not in my shoes or someone like me. This song along with alot of Bruno's hits speak volumes to me and my troubles

I've been a Anderson Paak fan since his song with Mac, I'm so glad to seem him and Bruno together in this amazing group.
This song is just gold with Bruno and Anderson .Paak delivering in spades their duo's smooth seductive late 60's early 70's R& B sound but with the delightful twist of sometimes humorous modern lyrics about a trifling ho of a woman. Really the whole idea of the duo's style in bringing smooth irresistible retro R&B into modern times is just pure genius. Love the whole vibe of the video too as a retro performance that keeps the humor of the song such as Anderson dramatically swooning after singing " Not to be dramatic, but I wanna die " and staying on the floor to jump right up in grand performance fashion on his next part as well as the never ending prop cigarettes they keep during the whole performance. Great job guys and keep it coming because I am so down for this retro modern fusion ride.

ð—¥ð˜‚ð˜€ð˜€ð—¶ð—®-ð—¨ð—¸ð—¿ð—®ð—¶ð—»ð—² ð—ªð—®ð—¿: ð—§ð—µð—² ð—£ð—®ð—»ð—±ð—¼ð—¿ð—® ð—•ð—¼ð˜… ð—¶ð˜€ ð—¢ð—½ð—²ð—» The ramifications of this war run much deeper than the impact it will cause to those directly involved in the conflict. It will reshape the world, as it is likely that other latent frictions between countries and territories will be activated as a consequence of the Russia-Ukraine situation. This war just opened an era of wars, small and large, between different peoples. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson recently said that this war could easily become "the biggest war in Europe since 1945", and I agree. If countries with similar backgrounds cannot reach agreement between them, then how much more likely it is that several countries that have big differences and ancient conflicts may easily slip into war for no apparent justifiable reason. On a personal level, it saddens me to see how fate turns around and once again we find ourselves at war. I am sorry and restless since I have many students in Russia and Ukraine who are under threat and feel how the deteriorating situation is affecting them and the whole world. In Israel, too, I have many students who follow with concern what is happening in Eastern Europe, anxious about the fate of their family members and friends. My hope is that the manifestations of hatred between the Russians and the Ukrainians will stop soon, two peoples who have lived side by side throughout history. If it were still possible, I would give everything I could to silence, calm down, avoid the escalation, but this is impossible for now.  There is not much that we can do at this stage. We can only long for peace and a ceasefire, talk about all parties showing restraint. The parties in conflict could follow the example of the Native American tribes who buried their hostility in a ceremony during which previously warring tribes agreed to settle their differences and live in harmony, and sealed their agreement by the chief of each tribe burying a war hatchet in the ground.  Such a scenario does not look realistic under the current circumstances. Thus, above the forces of hostility, above the egoism and control as the driving forces of all the conflicts in the world, we can only raise a global prayer for peace, asking that we all get along with everyone. Because only in the power of connection and in the connection between our hearts, can a great positive force arise, a force that is able to unite all parties, to reconcile the haters, to awaken the truth in us all that we all belong to one soul. As it is written, â€œHe who makes peace in His heights, may He make peace upon usâ€¦â€ (The Book of Job, 25:2)

Anderson Paak laying on the floor ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£
There is no doubt that this is a great song... And in the beginning, it was nice to see this young man recreating music from my time.... But now, I cannot help but notice that Bruno Mars has just made a living recreating every sound style from my generation. I have to say, it's genius, but the sound ain't original!Â  Sure, these songs are new to you young people, but this is not a new sound!  If you want to hear songs like this, all you have to do is look to the originators... The Stylistics, The Spinners, The Temptations, Ohio Players, The Cornelius Brothers, The Commodores, and that's just for starters! Â  I know I am going to get some kind of pushback and negative comments so I will just say this....One day, when you youngsters will be in your late 50's and 60's, you will hear some kid from that future making similar music to your time.  You'll hear someone recreating Rhianna, Shawn Mendes, The Weeknd, David Guetta, or someone else you like, and then, and only then, will you know exactly how I feel and what I am talking about! I will still give this video and song a thumbs up because it is a good song!

THIS LETS GET JUST THIS LIFE  SOMEBODY WONT BE LEAVING A ROSE ON MY GRAVE THINKING WHAT COULD OF BEEN ANYHOW IEYE TURNED DOWN THAT FAIRYTALE DREAM FOR TRUE LOVE NOT JUST THINKING OF MYSELF WANTING Can Anderson Paak save soul and RnB music ? Well when other ethnicities have to co-sign RnB soul artists it's a sad state of affairs . Everyone wants black music filtered thru other ethnicities ,I see the game and I'm aggravated . Subliminal racism  we like the sound but not from the people that originated it . Rock , folk , country , jazz . Now RnB and rap same soup warmed over . We as African Americans create so much for this country but are sidelined by other ethnicities that get rich off our gifts . The world would be bland without us but I smh when I see non African Americans capitalize on our gifts . Eurocentric capitalism loves African American contribution to art ,music , sport , fashion ,lingo , swag ECT but they hate the people ðŸ¤·ðŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ . Stop co-signing non African American culture vultures and thieves . @ Bruno Mars and many others .

WHEN WE ARE NOT BOTH IN OUR LOVE OF ANGEL ENERGY IT ALWAYS IS THE SAME STORY THAT LEAVES THE HEART BROKEN ,THE FEAR TO LOVE AGAIN AND TO KEEP ON RUNNING FROM THE TRUE LOVE OF TWINS THAT THE 4-EVER SOUL'S HEART IS HOLDING; IEYE AM SORRY THAT THIS LIFE WE CANT ME BECAUSE AS USUAL YOU ARE IN THE DEVIL ENERGY OF THE DARK MOON'S NIGHT AND IEYE AM IN THE ANGEL ENERGY OF SUN'S DAY GIVING US ONLY 1 NIGHT OF PASSIONATE LOVE THAT EVEN THE ANGEL ARE JEALOUS OF TO KNOW THAT IS ALL THAT IEYE WILL HAVE TO HOLD ONTO AND CARRY WITH ME WHEN YOU LEAVE IEYE CANT RELIVING THE SAME ALREADY WRIT SCRIPT STORY THAT IS NOT FULFILLING IN THE LOVE WE HAVE AND THE LOVE WE HAVE TO GIVE THAT OUR 4-EVER SOUL'S HEART IS HOLDING; IEYE SIT AND ASK HOW CAN WE ALWAYS BE CONNECTED AS TWINS  WITH A LOVE THAT IS SO PURE AND TRUE THAT WE CAN NOT HAVE MORE TIME TO BE TOGETHER IN PHYSICAL REALITY IEYE AM GOING TO TRY SOMETHING DIFFERENT IN THIS LIFE IN WHAT IEYE HAVE FOUND WITHIN ABOUT OUR TWIN SOUL RELATIONSHIP IEYE THINK WE NEVER CONNECTED  RIGHT WAY ON THE SPIRITUAL WAVE WE HAVE  ALWAYS CONNECTED  IN A LUSTFUL WAY OF SEXUAL INTIMACY  WE HAVE TO CONNECT IN THE RIGHT WAY AS TWINS DO BY SITTING IN FRONT OF EACH OTHER  FACE TO FACE TO  ANOTHER WITH HANDS UP TOUCHING TO PURIFY CLEANSE AND HEAL OUR ENERGY TOGETHER AS ONE IN TRUE LOVE OF THE TWINS SPIRITUAL SOULS CONNECTING; IEYE CAN HEAR WHAT YOU CALLING TO ME IEYE KNOW YOU ARE MAD BECAUSE YOU CANT BREAK MY  BARRIER  ON THE SPIRITUAL WAVE TO TAKE WHAT YOU WANTING ,  ITS LIKE WE ARE TWO WORLDS APART AND YOU CANT FALL INTO MY GRAVITY, IEYE WILLING TO COMPROMISE IF YOU ARE WILLING TO CONNECT AS TWINS IN THE RIGHT WAY WITHOUT ANY SEXUAL INTIMACY ; WHILE GOING WITHIN IEYE FOUND TWINS HAVE TO PURIFY CLEANSE AND HEAL THEIR ENERGY COMPLETELY  THE PROPER WAY FACING ONE ANOTHER HANDS TOUCHING BEFORE EVEN THINKING OF CONNECTING AS ONE IN SEXUAL INTIMACY; BECAUSE IEYE LOVE YOU IEYE AM WILLING TO HELP YOU IN THE PROPER WAY TWINS SHOU3 BE CONNECTING BY CLEANSING PURIFYING AND HEALING THEIR ENERGY;  IF IEYE COME TO YOU ON THE SPIRITUAL WAVE AND YOU TRY ANY GETTING YOUR WAY SEXUALLY IEYE AM GOING TO BOP YOU UPSIDE THE HEAD WITH MY POWERFUL LIGHT ENERGY AND LEAVE SO IEYE ASK FOR YOUR HONESTY FOR YOU TELL THE TRUTH AND NO LIES WITH MY QUESTION BACK AT YA CAN IEYE TRUST TO CONNECT THE PROPER WAY. THAT TWINS SHOULD BE CONNECTING  ON THE SPIRITUAL WAVE TO GET YOU OUT YOUR DEVIL ENERGY?

WHERE MY RHYME IS A CONTRAST. OF 2 PATHS OF THE DARK MOONS SLAVERY IN AN OCCULTIC FALSE BELUEF CONTROLLING SYSTEM FULL OF SLAVERY MORE OF NEGATIVE PATH OF SOMETHING YOU ARE NOT STRIFE PAIN AND SUFFERING THINKING ITS THE PATH TO HAPPINESS THEN THE PATH OF THE SUNS OF TRUTH BEING TRUE HIGHER SELF YOU ONLY FIND WITHIN BY TAPPING IN TUNING IN WITHIN TO FIND TRUE FREEDOM ON A POSITIVE LEVEL ESSENTIALLY MY RHYME IS CONTRAST BETWEEN TRUTH AND LIES  LIGHT AND DARKNESS LIFE AND DEATH FREEDOM AND SLAVERY. MANY HAVE JUMPED CONCLUSIONS BUT IEYE AM NOT FINISHED WORKING MY RHYME IEYE WANT PEOPLE TO SEE AND FIND THEIR FREEDOM TRUE POWER TRUE SELF TRUE HAPPINESS TO BREAK FREE. MOST LOST IN THE SAUCE OF THE PAST FULL OF DECEIT THAT ITS A LEFT AND RIGHT THING RED AND BLUE THING OF BLACK AND WHITE FALSE LIGHT YING AND YANG BLACK BEING FOR THE SHITHOLE HELLHOLE BLACKHOLE WHITE FALSE LIGHT STARS AND DARK MOONS THAT IS ALL OF THE PHYSICAL WORLD NO SPIRITUAL TRUTH BUT ITS MORE WITHIN SPIRITUAL OF TRUE SELF TO OUT PHYSICAL BREATHE IN. Um dos melhores cantores da atualidade
Just a detail folks: I LOVE Anderson .Paak's funky Bobby Womack glasses! Yes, God is in the details. And this video is crammed with nostalgic details. The dance moves are Temptationsly cool. Your heart melts instantly and a grin appears on your face. Mars & .Paak show the greatest respect for the old school tradition and yet add their pinch of humour and urban flavour. The clip's retro atmosphere is spot on and  the organic music is a hell of a throwback to 70s Soul splendour. These dudes have the guts to split the ocean of mediocre mainstream music with pure vintage magic. So effortlessly produced... in the year 2021! Sheer joy!

I was 18yrs old, the girl was fine and in my car looking beautiful as we were heading to Jack in the Box.  Back then monster tacos were buy 1 get 1 free.  To my surprise, she ordered 8 monster tacos, so we talking a total of 16 tacos.  We head back to her apartment and she opens the door and I see 6 lil kids.  4 were hers the other 2 were her sister's.  Where was this song in 1988?  We had simp songs like "It's cheaper to keep her" and other foolish songs from simp groups like Boyz to Men and Babyface.  Always Rescue Ronnie for birds, Captain Save'em were tricks and simps.
These two men have revived an entire genre of music that has been missed for far to long. God bless these musical gods

Jesus lived a sinless life and finally died on the cross to bear the punishment we deserve, we deserve to be punished because we have sinned. (it did not allow forgiveness of sins, Unlike Jesus's, it only temporarily covered them). Jesus is the Lamb of God, the ultimate sacrifice for sins which is enough for all sins that have been done, are done and will be done. Jesus was buried and rose again. What a shame. I have a lot of respect for Bruno's pure talent. But, to appropriate legacy Black music styles, then layer them with nonsense, little boy lyrical content demeaning to women is a huge insult to Black Americans, and a wasted opportunity. If you want to borrow from something, son, make it better, do honor to it or at least try to improve upon it. Don't mock it. Having a couple of co-signing black guys in your band doesn't entitle you to toy around with our classic compositions nor our culture. Maybe go back and listen to the substance and heart that was in much of that music, before you mimic pieces of it for a quick download/payday.

These days you can notice that every pop musician is trying to make the old vibes songs. I don't wanna write their name but you can see them in every trending charts/playlists with an 80s/90s synthwave type music. They are trying to be mainstream and tries to follow the recent past year's hits (like most of Bruno's hits). If you pay attention to detail you can realize it's not sounding actually like an old retro song, all these new 80s sounding songs doesn't sound original same as retro-pop music. It's all made in computer and DAW softwares, which sounds good but not exact like an authentic old song.   But in Bruno's music you can purely feel that original old music vibes. He makes his own melodies, they try to play real instruments, Vocal mixings just same as old songs, a smooth and simple music video concept and setup, groove and funk bassline elements and even the lyrics are too perfect as an 80s R&B song. In my point of view, they are the most talented and realest musician of this generation. There's no question now why they took too long to make an average length project. If these album underperforms, this generation has lost a music taste so badly.

What a wholehearted faithful committment to the genre and time period this song and video represents! Bruno's direction is right on point, especially the visual of their smoking on screen, which was common in the 60's. Even Bruno's look reminds me of Sammy Davis Jr. The sound is the perfect marriage of Philly International and Motown, the look is pure Motown, and vocally evokes the Temps, Delfonics and Bobby Womac mixed with Maxwell and Prince. Death, it's one of the biggest events that will ever take place in your life. We face death everyday, conscious or unconsciously of it; death lurks around every corner of our life. Like a lion waiting to catch its prey, death comes for us all in many shapes and forms; seemingly there is no one who can escape from the jaws of death.  But did you know there is a reason why we die? The idea of death you're familiar with is only the tip of the iceberg. See we die because we've sinned against God. Death according to the bible is wages " for the wages of sin is death " (Romans 6:23).  Because man sinned against God, we live in a fallen world, it was once perfect, but now in ruins. Now that sin exists, God is coming to judge the world In righteousness. "It's appointed a man once to die and after this judgement" (Hebrews 9:27) The standard he'll judge you by is the 10 commandments, God's moral law.  He's so serious about sin that he gives anyone who sins the death sentence, the bible says you've earned it through sinning against God and God pays you in death. Each time you sin you build up his wrath. â€œThe soul who sins shall die.â€ (Ezekiel 18:4) The punishment is the eternal fires of Hell " Where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth" (Matthew 13:42)  You will have to face God on Judgement Day.   Will you go to Heaven or Hell?  Hereâ€™s a quick test:   1.You shall have no other gods before Me. (Have you always loved God above all else?)   2.You shall not make yourself an idol. (Have you made a god in your mind that you're more comfortable with, a god to suit yourself?)   3.You shall not take God's name in vain. (Have you ever used God's holy Name as a cuss word?)   4.Remember the Sabbath Day, to keep it holy.   5.Honor your father and mother.   6. You shall not murder. (God considers hatred to be as murder, 1 John 3:15).   7. You shall not commit adultery. ("Whoever looks upon a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart" Matthew 5:27-28; this also includes sex before marriage).   8. You shall not steal. (Have you ever stolen anything? the value of the item is irrelevant).   9. You shall not lie. (Have you lied even once? Including answering these questions).   10. You shall not covet. (Have you ever jealousy desired what belongs to others?)   James 2:10 says, â€œthe person who keeps all of the laws except one is as guilty as a person who has broken all of Godâ€™s laws.â€Â    The Bible says that God will punish all murderers, rapists, thieves, liars, adulterers, etc. He will even judge our words and thoughts.   If you have done any of those things, God sees you as guilty of breaking His law and the Bible warns that the guilty will end up in Hell. Will YOU be guilty on Judgement Day?Â    "For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord." (Romans 6:23)   God sent His Son to suffer and die on the cross. Jesus took the punishment upon Himself and defeated death on the cross; not because you're Good but because God is rich in mercy.   â€œFor God so loved the world that He gave His only Son, whoever believes in Him should not perish but have eternal life.â€ (John 3:16)   Jesus rose from the dead and defeated death. Repent (turn from sin) today and trust in Jesus and God will grant you everlasting life.   Then, Read the Bible and obey what you read.   Pray something like this:   "Dear God, today I turn away from all of my sins (name them). Today I put my trust in Jesus Christ as my Lord and Savior. He is the only way for me to be saved. He is 'The way, the truth, and the life.'" Please forgive me, change my heart, and grant me Your gift of everlasting life. In Jesus' name I pray. Amen."   When you find time please read this, it's Christian principles for growth:   https://www.livingwaters.com/save-yourself-some-pain/

I tried alcohol smoked cigarettes They did nothing but give me regrets. My mom had arthritis could not walk around I rolled her a joint she danced on the ground.  I thought I was losing my lovemaking knack After I smoked some to me it came back. Soon I decided prices were high I searched for some ground I wouldn't have to buy.  I bargained for seeds from smokers all around  Got in my truck and drove out of town. I walked through the woods where wild birds nest  Found me the meadow I thought was the best.  I dug up the ground sowed all my seeds Said a small prayer for strong, healthy weeds. I watered at night with a five-gallon pail  Mosquitoes went hungry for I wore a veil.  Seven months went by; I thought I would die Till the Halloween moon was high in the sky. At night I went out, in a camouflage suit  Used my corn knife to chop down the loot.  I hung it up to dry where it couldnâ€™t be found. Came back and got it, when it had turned brown. I trimmed off the buds, stuffed them in bags Called all my friends and passed out free drags.  In less than a week my crop was gone  I flew to St. Thomas with a love hungry blonde!!  By Kansas City Poet Tom Zart Google = Most Published Poet On The Web Tomâ€™s 1,650 Poems Are Free To Share! I've grown up listening to Bruno Mars. I'm now 17 years old and listening to this song makes me so happy, I can't even describe it. He always manages to show off everytime since he has the ability to show off his feelings and express them while singing (especially when he hits the high notes). I just have to say, hats off to Bruno. This collaboration is FIRE. From Leave the Door Open, to Skate, and now Smokin Out The Window. Though this song is different than the other two because of the beat. It's so chill and relaxing but at the same time it makes you want to dance? I can't explain it. But this song is definitely a masterpiece. I'm so proud of them all (the ones that collaborated in this song). I'm happy to know that I've been growing up to his music too! Makes me super happy. I'm definitely blessed.     If you read all this, I just want to say that you're all wonderful people. Don't ever give up in your dreams and fight for you want. Take care <33
